circumstances: Brenda Brown was last seen near her home on Gordon Crescent, displaying signs of concern to those around her due to an emerging pattern of addiction behaviors despite her young age. The situation escalated when she wandered off from the after-school program she attended, sparking worry among the staff and her foster father, William Thomas. The search concentrated on a nearby campground where Brenda had visited previously with her friends, Melissa and Angela Martin. The initial suspicion was that she had gone there on her own. Fortunately, her whereabouts were discovered promptly, and she was safely traced by police to Dee Street, Banchory.

circumstances: Brenda Brown, a 10-year-old foster child, was reported missing from her home at Gordon Crescent. Before her disappearance, Brenda was last seen leaving school, where she was talking with her friend, Duncan Palmer. Concern arose when she didn't return home and was not seen at her usual hangouts, including 10 Garden Wood, Inchmarlo, or Dee Street, Banchory. Friends and other connections, including Duncan, were unable to provide additional information about her whereabouts. After a thorough search, Brenda was eventually found safe in Seafield Circle, Buckie, having traveled by herself. Her family, relieved, traced her there and brought her home without incident.

circumstances: Brenda Brown was last seen leaving the after-school program by her friend, Duncan Palmer. She was supposed to head home directly to Gordon Crescent, AB34 5HJ. When Brenda didn't arrive home, her foster father, William Thomas, grew concerned and contacted Yvonne Holmes, a family friend, who reported she hadn't seen Brenda since earlier at school. Initial investigations focused on common routes Brenda took, often meeting friends at Carmelite Street, Banff, AB45 1GF. The police investigation later revealed that Brenda had boarded a bus heading towards Dee Street, Banchory, AB31 5HS, leading to further search efforts across interconnecting locations. Brenda was eventually traced to Rannes Street, Insch, AB52 6JJ, unharmed.

circumstances: Brenda Brown, an 11-year-old girl, was reported missing from her home on Gordon Crescent. Her foster father, William Thomas, mentioned Brenda had expressed an interest in visiting a nearby campground. Friends noted she had recently been seen in the company of Duncan Palmer near a sports club known for its questionable activities. Brenda was believed to be involved in minor criminal activity and was thought to be homeless, adding complexity to her disappearance. Eventually, she was traced by family in Seafield Circle, Buckie. Her sighting near March Road led them to her, unharmed but in need of reassurance and support, suggesting she may have sought independence but underestimated the challenges of her actions.
